com.knowgate.addrbook

Class WorkingCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.knowgate.addrbook.WorkingCalendar

  • public class WorkingCalendar
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents a working/non working time calendar

    Version:
    4.0

      • isWorkingDay

        public java.lang.Boolean isWorkingDay(int iDate)
                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Get working / non working day status
        Parameters:
        iDate - An integer representing a date in format yyyymmdd
        Returns:
        Boolean True if given date is a working day, False if given date is a holiday, or null if given date is not defined at this calendar
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • isWorkingDay

        public java.lang.Boolean isWorkingDay(java.util.Date oDate)
                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Get working / non working day status
        Parameters:
        oDate - Date to be checked
        Returns:
        Boolean True if given date is a working day, False if given date is a holiday, or null if given date is not defined at this calendar
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • isWorkingDay

        public java.lang.Boolean isWorkingDay(long lDate)
        Get working / non working day status
        Parameters:
        lDate - An long representing a date in miliseconds
        Returns:
        Boolean True if given date is a working day, False if given date is a holiday, or null if given date is not defined at this calendar

      • getWorkDaysArray

        public short[] getWorkDaysArray(JDCConnection oConn,
                       int iFromYear,
                       int iFromMonth,
                       int nMonths)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.sql.SQLException
        Get array of working vs. non-working days for a months period
        Parameters:
        JDCConnection -
        iFromYear - int Year to start from
        iFromMonth - int Month to start from [0..11]
        Returns:
        Array of short values one for each day starting from the given year and month and lasting n-months. Each value of the array may be 1 meaning a WorkDay, -1 meaning a Holyday or 0 meaning that the day is not defined neither as Workday nor as Holyday at this calendar.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if iFromYear<1900 or iFromMonth not between 0 and 11 or nMonths is less than 1
        java.sql.SQLException
